title: Engineering & Technology Education (2023-24): Exploration of Aerospace Technology and Career Planning (8600052)
subject: CTE

document.title: FLDOE - CTE Curriculum Frameworks - Middle School - Integrated Technology Studies

7357CD656E9C40B280DD59B496711111.description: Define air carrier and be able identify air carrier aircraft types.

D468CE8AAFF84945959E5AF03D86CB34.description: Describe subsystems of aerospace vehicles, such as structural, propulsion, suspension, guidance, control, and support that must function together for a system to work effectively.

BA82E39EA425418EBEC9C20E1C5413E1.description: Demonstrate proper and safe procedures while working with technological tools, apparatus, equipment, systems, and materials.--The student will be able to:

89332EF924774953AE2C3B74C75A4C27.description: Describe communication systems made up of a source, encoder, transmitter, receiver, decoder, and destination (e.g. phonetic alphabet).

A68EF4B576484DDDAE99D60F2D82CB05.description: Design and use instruments to gather data.

A15F1C00415D4C12AA7EAC9FD498AB78.description: Demonstrate the abilities to assess the impact of products and systems.--The student will be able to:

E3B01ACFF7A44B4DAADFAA0448190C25.description: Use computers and calculators in various applications.

7B8892D838B148C5B9ABEE6DFD3AADCB.description: Use information provided in manuals, protocols, or by experienced people to see and understand how things work.

AB608DDD2E38471BB33EB013D5752F9C.description: Demonstrate the abilities to use and maintain technological products and systems.--The student will be able to:

66E52949E64345F6B80853EC12787679.description: Make a product or system and document the solution.

6C432C599F284AE3807E08C2EF82327E.description: Test and evaluate the design in relation to pre-established requirements, such as criteria and constraints, and refine as needed.

A3D96E2889194D7A9ED44F3B27E0BC57.description: Make two-dimensional and three-dimensional representations of the designed solution.

4FF9D83A1B96456685FA04CF6A7FF78D.description: Specify criteria and constraints for the design.

3DCF7D1B1A784F4A8C4E5769B1617040.description: Apply a design process to solve problems in and beyond the laboratory-classroom.

C1C2EC1288FC4975A84035297798B140.description: Demonstrate the abilities to apply the design process.--The student will be able to:

689F4B80CBBF4A859E8BAF273A732F97.description: 10.03 Identify technological problems that are best solved through experimentation.

AAB609DA11C943609CBA0C40A38D0776.description: 10.02 Describe invention as a process of turning ideas and imagination into devices and systems and innovation as the process of modifying an existing product or system to improve it.

1FDB46F913B04269BD9334BFECD1C5E5.description: 10.01 Use troubleshooting as a problem-solving method used to identify the cause of a malfunction in a technological system.

9A26DEC67F934C7AA0243EB72CFFD4DC.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role of troubleshooting, research and development, invention and innovation, and experimentation in problem solving.--The student will be able to:

E3C9107F3ECE4724938E2C407D3BFEFD.description: Model, test, evaluate and modify designs to transform ideas into practical solutions.

A186BB58C3664B759EB772832ACF42D4.description: Employ brainstorming as a group problem-solving design process in which each person in the group presents his or her ideas in an open forum.

447E04105C9146599188FE0EEA2FB02F.description: Utilize the design process involving a set of steps, which can be performed in different sequences and repeated as needed.

D18741FDB59747D2845E77CE9B6DC860.description: Demonstrate an understanding of engineering design.--The student will be able to:

F58AEF2FCE2C4AAE96FF6882C6015420.description: Explain why there is no perfect design.

062F72EE80F24FA7B6ED4713072C6921.description: Use design as a creative planning process that leads to useful products and systems.

3E446EFCDDAB44F287A55DF8FAE25FF9.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the attributes of design.--The student will be able to:

07F3FAACA5F04A779F8652F14C6C1891.description: Investigate how, that in the past, an invention or innovation was not usually developed with the knowledge of science.

662DA5184F3340BC8C3E9664761E4388.description: Identify the design and construction of structures for service or convenience evolving from the development of techniques for measurement, controlling systems, and the understanding of spatial relationships.

F8ACF7BA949644CAAF1237FD6CB8F4FB.description: Explain how the specialization of function has been at the heart of many technological improvements.

90F783A962BB4E0BA450BF3D755CD6DE.description: Identify inventions and innovations that have evolved by using slow and methodical processes of tests and refinements.

D3BC028E97BE49C292463154CFEAABC2.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the influence of technology on history.--The student will be able to:

388A865D890646788C3F3ADA3CA4090D.description: Explain how meeting societal expectations is the driving force behind the acceptance and use of products and systems.

6480DF1FA49744B090AD041829327359.description: Understand social and cultural priorities and values that are reflected in technological devices.

400DBFBFBA124F17BEBB0DBA49A9532F.description: Describe changes in society and the creation of new needs and wants caused by the use of inventions and innovations.

C30061BB95704BD19B1833C2AD93964F.description: Describe the development of technologies that has resulted from the demands, values, and interests of individuals, businesses, industries, and societies.

5E681461A8E247CD895A081628327E44.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role of society in the development and use of technology.--The student will be able to:

546CCE738CED4847B2E5B748B2A7344A.description: Make decisions about the development and use of technologies that put environmental and economic concerns in direct competition with one another.

D2A817A3A1784671B7A58FB4AA602FAD.description: Describe how technologies can be used to repair damage and to break down waste from the use of various products and systems.

2700679B3A0A4A46B36BEFFFC69357B7.description: Describe the management of waste produced by technological systems as an important societal issue.

F22C7241EECB41D080E8C7942207FDB2.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the effects of technology on the environment.--The student will be able to:

A86612DE29AC48F0A20BDA15C81D66B7.description: Identify the economic, political, and cultural issues that are influenced by the development and use of technology.

EE1885D465F84509979E3B4062CF9786.description: Identify ethical issues associated with the development and use of technology.

E58C82E0F92A41F1B8FC9B4C64841F1E.description: Explain that technology, by itself, is neither good nor bad; but decisions about the use of products and systems can result in desirable or undesirable consequences.

DC2A7FF532D8403E9D9E017762031AA9.description: Identify the ways that use of technology affects humans, including their safety, comfort, choices, and attitudes about technology’s development and use.

C49D96644E7C4BF3BCCCD6C9E75F566D.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the cultural, social, economic, and political effects of technology.--The student will be able to:

CE511AD87DA6463C8EC1130D43243D41.description: Explain how knowledge gained from other fields of study has a direct effect on the development of technological products and systems.

D55C631082C84165B8355B2E046F169A.description: Apply a product, system, or environment developed for one setting in another setting.

60B9C4F0AC664FD5A93698885BF02C68.description: Modify the way technological systems interact with one another.

05CD24D819BD4FD5A11E43CCF5C03CCE.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the relationships among technologies and the connection between technology and other fields of study.--The student will be able to:

8222F35127BE453FA198AF423190C699.description: Utilize controls and mechanisms or particular steps that people perform using information about the system that causes systems to change.

E722348BA5A54BC09EBE03D99A54CF0B.description: Perform basic maintenance as the process of inspecting and servicing a product or system on a regular basis in order for it to continue functioning properly, to extend its life, or to upgrade its capability.

35ED8BC97B254866865093821F4D71F6.description: Describe different technologies that involve different sets of processes.

2BDFA978E58142A68D7C7379E573C35D.description: Compare and contrast trade-offs as a decision process recognizing the need for careful compromises among competing factors.

5EDC84D9D09C4021B90EA3F043877178.description: Compare and contrast requirements or parameters placed on the development of a product or system.

7B444236BFA049DE9A15DD7F67C00BC2.description: Repair malfunctions of any part of a system that may affect the function and quality of the system.

9D39420847634F99A6C140056063E565.description: Explain how technological systems can be connected to one another.

B230ED9240434C709FA64911D0D90C97.description: Identify control systems having no feedback path and requiring human intervention, and control systems using feedback.

E8BB9857C0F1459B8F351F6D3BCD1A64.description: Apply systems thinking, involving considering how every part relates to others.

AC1358A499DE4C2A8CC8B4CA25DB55A5.description: Describe technological systems including input, processes, output, and, at times, feedback.

1E42AB5A9803417B91CC0B3C3AD662BE.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the core concepts of technology.--The student will be able to:

5C2294218E8D4E0EADFC2C5D3EBDACE8.description: Describe the development of technology as a human activity that is the result of individual or collective needs and the ability to be creative.

440870B2591F4A9FAA643DD71308D91A.description: Demonstrate how corporations can often create demand for a product by bringing it onto the market and advertising it.

EE989A18BFF74A5793D4BD2B72F3F0E5.description: Explain how technology is closely linked with creativity, which has resulted in innovation.

997DD864201B4E1AACAB8C98F9760545.description: Describe the development of technology as a human activity that is the result of individual or collective needs and the ability to be creative.
